ul.li: When the process is stopped, the durable subscriptions that are used to receive published messages remain active. Therefore, any messages that are published while the process is stopped are delivered as soon as the process is restarted. As the messages are buffered, the maximum messages limit of the destination mapping rules might be reached. This limit prevents publishers from sending any more messages. If you do not want this behavior, or if you are stopping the process for a long time, disable all the destination mapping rules before you stop the process. For more information about disabling destination mapping rules, see .
